channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-19196] Bulk delete api doesn't take the path to delete as the base path
item.description: If you use the path of the file you intend to delete as the base path, you get an error. This is because the validation requires the list to be of children, but the base path itself should be valid.
item.summary: Bulk delete api doesn't take the path to delete as the base path

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
we need a contract test for this.

code to trigger this

io.bulkDelete_delete(fs, path, Lists.newArrayList(path)))

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Path file:/Users/stevel/Projects/hadoop-trunk/hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/target/test/data/zfms3Bqvmq/testOpenLocalFile is not under the base path file:/Users/stevel/Projects/hadoop-trunk/hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/target/test/data/zfms3Bqvmq/testOpenLocalFile

	at org.apache.hadoop.util.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:213)
	at org.apache.hadoop.fs.BulkDeleteUtils.lambda$validateBulkDeletePaths$0(BulkDeleteUtils.java:45)
	at java.util.ArrayList.forEach(ArrayList.java:1259)
	at org.apache.hadoop.fs.BulkDeleteUtils.validateBulkDeletePaths(BulkDeleteUtils.java:43)
	at org.apache.hadoop.fs.impl.DefaultBulkDeleteOperation.bulkDelete(DefaultBulkDeleteOperation

mukund-thakur opened a new pull request, #6872:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/6872

Follow up on HADOOP-18679.

-->

      1. Description of PR
      1. How was this patch tested?
        Re-ran all the implementation of AbstractContractBulkDeleteTest
      1. For code changes:
  • [ ] Does the title or this PR starts with the corresponding JIRA issue id (e.g. 'HADOOP-17799. Your PR title ...')?
  • [ ] Object storage: have the integration tests been executed and the endpoint declared according to the connector-specific documentation?
  • [ ] If adding new dependencies to the code, are these dependencies licensed in a way that is compatible for inclusion under [ASF 2.0](http://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html#category-a)?
  • [ ] If applicable, have you updated the `LICENSE`, `LICENSE-binary`, `NOTICE-binary` files?

##########

  • @return true if the path is under the base path.

update the comment to match the new code
